dn30:0.2: The Marks of a Great Man
dn30:1.1.2: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.

dn30:1.1.7: “There are thirty-two marks of a great man. A great man who possesses these has only two possible destinies, no other.
dn30:1.1.8: If he stays at home he becomes a king, a wheel-turning monarch, a just and principled king. His dominion extends to all four sides, he achieves stability in the country, and he possesses the seven treasures.
dn30:1.1.9: He has the following seven treasures:
dn30:1.1.10: the wheel, the elephant, the horse, the jewel, the woman, the treasurer, and the counselor as the seventh treasure.
dn30:1.1.11: He has over a thousand sons who are valiant and heroic, crushing the armies of his enemies.
dn30:1.1.12: After conquering this land girt by sea, he reigns by principle, without rod or sword.
dn30:1.1.13: But if he goes forth from the lay life to homelessness, he becomes a perfected one, a fully awakened Buddha, who draws back the veil from the world.

dn30:1.4.1: In some past lives, past existences, past abodes the Realized One was reborn as a human being. He firmly undertook and persisted in skillful behaviors such as good conduct by way of body, speech, and mind, giving and sharing, taking precepts, observing the sabbath, paying due respect to mother and father, ascetics and brahmins, honoring the elders in the family, and various other things pertaining to skillful behaviors.
dn30:1.4.2: Due to performing, accumulating, heaping up, and amassing those deeds, when his body broke up, after death, he was reborn in a good place, a heavenly realm.
dn30:1.4.3: There he surpassed the other gods in ten respects: divine life span, beauty, happiness, glory, sovereignty, sights, sounds, smells, tastes, and touches.

dn30:2.16.0: 24–25. One Hair Per Pore, and a Tuft
dn30:2.16.1: “Mendicants, in some past lives the Realized One was reborn as a human being.
dn30:2.16.2: He refrained from lying. He spoke the truth and stuck to the truth. He was honest and trustworthy, and didn’t trick the world with his words.
dn30:2.16.3: Due to performing those deeds he was reborn in a heavenly realm.
dn30:2.16.4: When he came back to this state of existence he obtained these two marks:
dn30:2.16.5: his hairs grow one per pore, and between his eyebrows there grows a tuft, soft and white like cotton-wool.
dn30:2.17.1: Possessing these marks, if he stays at home he becomes a wheel-turning monarch.
dn30:2.17.2: And what does he obtain as king?
dn30:2.17.3: He has many close adherents among the brahmins and householders, people of town and country, treasury officials, military officers, guardsmen, ministers, counselors, rulers, tax beneficiaries, and princes.
dn30:2.17.4: That’s what he obtains as king.
dn30:2.17.5: And what does he obtain as Buddha?
dn30:2.17.6: He has many close adherents among the monks, nuns, laymen, laywomen, gods, humans, demons, dragons, and fairies.
dn30:2.17.7: That’s what he obtains as Buddha.”

dn30:2.19.1: “Mendicants, in some past lives the Realized One was reborn as a human being.
dn30:2.19.2: He refrained from divisive speech. He didn’t repeat in one place what he heard in another so as to divide people against each other. Instead, he reconciled those who were divided, supporting unity, delighting in harmony, loving harmony, speaking words that promote harmony.

dn30:2.28.1: “Mendicants, in some past lives the Realized One was reborn as a human being.
dn30:2.28.2: He gave up wrong livelihood and earned a living by right livelihood. He refrained from falsifying weights, metals, or measures; bribery, fraud, cheating, and duplicity; mutilation, murder, abduction, banditry, plunder, and violence.
